intro: Psoralea decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
